summary: Email correspondence from an Assistant U.S. Attorney to the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding a subpoena and request for inmate Jeffrey Epstein's phone call recordings and email correspondence from July 6-11, 2019, excluding communications with his attorneys. The document reveals the immediate investigative actions taken following Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose phone calls and emails from July 6-11, 2019, are being subpoenaed by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Marc Fernich
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys whose communications with Epstein are to be excluded from the subpoenaed materials.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys whose communications with Epstein are to be excluded from the subpoenaed materials.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys whose communications with Epstein are to be excluded from the subpoenaed materials.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who can be contacted with questions about the subpoena.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: A prosecutor from the Southern District of New York who can be contacted with questions about the subpoena.

persons.name: Supervisory Staff Attorney CLC
persons.context: The attorney at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center who confirms they have no calls or emails for Epstein at the time of the request.

connections.description: Fernich is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys, and communications between them are legally protected from the subpoena.
Weinberg is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys, and communications between them are legally protected from the subpoena.
Weingarten is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys, and communications between them are legally protected from the subpoena.
Both are Assistant U.S. Attorneys in the Southern District of New York working on the Epstein case, as indicated by being listed as contacts.

events.title: Subpoena for Epstein's Communications
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office subpoenas and requests all phone call recordings and email correspondence of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, excluding attorney-client communications.

events.title: Response from Correctional Center
events.description: A Supervisory Staff Attorney at the Metropolitan Correctional Center confirms they have no calls or emails for Epstein at that time.

locations: New York Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein immediately after his arrest, seeking his jail communications from July 6-11, 2019.
Epstein's legal defense team at the time included attorneys Marc Fernich, Martin Weinberg, and Reid Weingarten.
The request specifically excluded attorney-client privileged communications, indicating a focus on non-legal contacts.
The urgency of the request is highlighted by setting the return date for the subpoena the day after it was issued.
